title: NASA Completes Last OSIRIS-REx Test Before Asteroid Sample Delivery
summary: A team led by NASA in Utah’s West Desert is in the final stages of preparing for the arrival of the first U.S. asteroid sample – slated to land on Earth in September.

title: NASA Deep Space Network Critically Overworked & Underfunded
summary: NASA's Deep Space Network (DSN) is a critical system that allows communication with spacecraft exploring our solar system and the cosmos,but it is facing an unprecedented strain due to a perfect storm of increased demand and diminishing financial resources.

title: NASA Awards Contracts for NOAA Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications Study
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), has awarded four contracts to conduct NOAA’s Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications (SMBA) Phase-A study.

title: Firefly ready for call-up to launch military ‘responsive space’ mission
summary: Firefly Aerospace and Millennium Space Systems announced Aug. 30 that they are standing by waiting for orders from the U.S. Space Force to prepare to launch a mission to low Earth orbit.

title: TransAstra Secures NASA Contract, Partners With ThinkOrbital On Debris Capture Bag System
summary: TransAstra, a pioneering space logistics startup, has secured an initial contract from NASA to manufacture an innovative inflatable capture bag designed to tackle the growing problem of orbital debris.

title: Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Postponed Again Due To Technical Issues
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) has revealed that a test-firing of the Ariane 6 core stage, originally planned for August 29, had to be postponed due to technical problems involving the control bench responsible for propellant loading and the automated countdown process.

title: Why did SpaceX give up on “catching” falling fairings? Its VP of launch explains
summary: "You basically had this really awesome algorithm, this crazy automation."

title: A Short Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Has Been Postponed
summary:
ESA announced earlier today that a short hot fire test of the Ariane 6 core stage equipped with its Vulcain 2.1 engine has been delayed. The test was due to take place on 29 August on the new Ariane 6 launchpad at the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana. In a short announcement on the […]
The post A Short Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Has Been Postponed appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ESA postpones Ariane 6 hot-fire test again
summary: The European Space Agency says a test-firing of an Ariane 6 core stage has been postponed again, this time because of issues with ground equipment.

title: NASA Deep Space Network reaches “critical point” as demand grows
summary: Increasing demand but decreasing budgets are putting a strain on NASA’s Deep Space Network (DSN), threatening its ability to provide communications for the agency’s science missions and Artemis lunar expeditions.
